intro: Stackhousia pubescens f. genuina, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It is a perennial herb with a short stem and broad, strap-like leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes.
